description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
year the data point was obtained
month the data point was obtained
day of the month the data point was obtained
name of the participant
age provided by author in data file
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
sex of the participant
species of individuals participating in the study -bonobo/chimpanzee/gorilla/orangutan
set of trials - mostly occurring on the same day - usually numerical
presentation of the experiment to the ape participants - usually numerical
condition applied – Experimental (tool: breadstick – reward: grapes) / Grissini&Block (control – tool: breadstick – reward: block) / Stick&Grapes (control – tool: wooden stick – reward: grapes)
participant drop out /not included in analyses
group (between subjects) – grissini_pieces (ape fed breadstick pieces before test) / grissini_sticks (ape fed breadsticks before test) / none (ape not fed with breadsticks before test)
success in the Experimental and the Stick&Grapes condition – ape rakes in the grapes / Grissini&Wood – ape does not rake-in

ape touches reward with tool but does not retrieve it (eg because the breadstick breaks) – success / attempt / rake_hesitation / rake_toolate exclude each other (yet not in the control Grissini&Block – when they do not rake-in but try to – success and attempt = 1)
insert breadstick through mesh but not touching the reward before breadstick is too short to rake in
insert breadstick through mesh but not touching the reward after breadstick is too short to rake in
the way the ape took the tool from the experimenter – hand / mouth
indicates if the ape touches the tool with her mouth before the very first rake attempt in a trial (attempt = touch object with tool) – yes / no

indicates if the ape touches the tool with her mouth before successfully raking in the reward (yes / no) – Grissini&Block (success = no rake-in) – yet - here mouthBefore_success inidcates if the ape touches the tool with her mouth before touching the block with her fingers
food item eaten first after success – Grissini / grapes / GrissiniEatenBefore (breadstick eaten before both were in the apes hands)
indicates how many grapes the ape sacrifices for a breadstick across all preference trials conducted after the study (score 0-36) – high scores indicate a preference for breadsticks
